eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule

Class GeometricObjectQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.zidek.augustin.minuscule.GeometricObjectQueue

  • public class GeometricObjectQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    Queue storing the geometric objects. It is optimized for frequent inserts and occasional sorted iteration. The geometric objects are sorted by their layer. Moreover, multiple threads can access this queue, but the thread asking for sorted data might not get some data that have been very recently put into the buffer. However, this is sufficient for the current purposes. This data structure is used in the following scenario: One thread adds new objects into the queue. Once per while EDT schedules repaint on the canvas and objects need to be retrieved sorted by their layer and displayed.
    Author:
    Augustin Zidek

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeometricObjectQueue

        public GeometricObjectQueue()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(MGeometricObject object)
        Adds the given object into the queue. The cost of this operation is amortized O(1).

        Implementation note: The object is added into a internal buffer (in block synchronized on the buffer), which is copied into the whole queue only when getSortedList() executed.

        Parameters:
        object - The object to be added.

      • flushBuffer

        public void flushBuffer()
        Forces the internal buffer to be flushed into the whole queue. The cost of this operation is amortized O(n) where n is the size of the buffer.

      • getSortedList

        public java.util.List<MGeometricObject> getSortedList()
        Gets the sorted list of the elements in the queue, sorted by the object's layers. The cost of this operation is O(n*log(n)) if objects have been added/modified in the queue, O(1) if not.

        Implementation note: flushBuffer() is called and then if modified, internal list holding the objects gets sorted using the built-in Java sort. If objects not modified, internal list returned without sorting.

        Returns:
        The sorted list of the objects in the queue, sorted by their layers. A copy of the queue is actually returned, so that it can be modified without any risk of illegal concurrent access to the queue's internal structure.

      • remove

        public void remove(MGeometricObject object)
        Removes the given object.

        Implementation note: the method tries to remove the object from the internal queue. If successful remove(object) == true, then done. Otherwise it attempts to remove it from the buffer.

        Parameters:
        object - The object to be removed. If it doesn't exist within the queue, nothing happens.

      • markDirty

        public void markDirty()
        Tells the queue that layer of one of its elements has been modified.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the queue, i.e. removes all elements from the buffer and from the internal list.
